ByzFL Documentation#

Welcome to the official documentation of ByzFL powered by DCL from EPFL!

ByzFL is a Python Library for Byzantine-resilient Federated Learning compatible with PyTorch tensors and NumPy arrays.

ByzFL provides three main tools.

  1. Robust aggregations and pre-aggregations.

  2. Implementation of attacks.

  3. Pipeline to train and benchmark new methods using ByzFL implemented schemes.

Our code is available on Github

Getting Started

You can install the ByzFL module with pip command.

>>> pip install byzfl

The byzfl module is then ready to use. For instance, to use the Minimum-Diameter Averaging robust aggregation:

>>> import byzfl
>>> import numpy as np
>>>
>>> agg = byzfl.MDA(1)
>>> x = np.array([[1., 2., 3.],       # np.ndarray
>>>               [4., 5., 6.],
>>>               [7., 8., 9.]])
>>> agg(x)
array([2.5 3.5. 4.5])

Learn more about ByzFL:
